Is there a reason for this not to be `static constexpr`? That would be convenient because it can be inlined then:
```C++
static constexpr Double_t fgExtraRangeFraction = 0.0;
```
Maybe that is better to make sure these liker errors such as reported in https://github.com/root-project/root/pull/8437 cannot happen.
Ah nevermind, I see it is changed by `SetDefaultExtraRange`!
